messages.subject: moving forward!!!
messages.msgSnippet: very well stated and thanks that was sweet of you to say, Karen ... no, I won t go away just yet but this sort of stuff just sucks the life right out of me and
messages.messageBody:
very well stated and thanks that was sweet of you to say, Karen ... no, I
won't go away just yet but this sort of stuff just sucks the life right out
of me and everyone else, I'm sure :P

NOW??? happy thoughts??? someone??? anyone??? lets rev this up a bit w/
some FUN talk about our sweet kidlets or Buzz's *Z* recipes or does anyone
have anything NEAT planned for the new week??? or WHO'Z PAINTED THEIR NAILS
W/ PURPLE GLITTER FINGERNAIL POLISH??? well, I HAVE and my dh thought I'd
totally LOST MY MARBLES!!! and goodness, that glitter polish was BUGGAR to
remove but sure did look cute w/ my RED birkenstocks and denim jumper!!!
lol!!! ok~ok, I know, I'm amusing only to myself!!! <G>

NOW ~> *TAG* it's someone else's TURN, JUST JUMP IN and talk about something
FUN and lets *not* let this little set~back get us down and lets MOVE
FORWARD :)

Pris ~> buzzing off to iron to get ready for Sunday services <SMILE>






----- Original Message -----
From: <HPaulson5@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, June 24, 2000 10:18 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]Who's Dr Laura anyway? :)


> In a message dated 6/24/00 10:09:04 AM Central Daylight Time,
> NumoAstro@... writes:
>
> << The whole "sounding like Dr. Laura" thing... >>
> Ok, sorry to be a dunce, but I don't know who this is! Here it is, Sat.
> night, and I have been gone all day, and have just gone through the posts
> regarding feminism/daycare. I have been on this list since late March.
This
> is not the first time a heated discussion has taken place....one of the
last
> "biggies" was about nursing vs bottle feeding. It went on for what seemed
> like about 2 weeks.It was filled with emotion, and passion, facts, and
> opinions, much like this topic is. It is my hope that everyone can agree
to
> disagree, and move on. Pris, I really enjoy your posts. It would be sad
to
> lose you due to a topic that will run its course in a matter of time. I
hope
> that you, and everyone else, will stay on. There are so many points I
> agree and disagree with from the posts, but, ultimately, I think what
matters
> most is doing what is right for each of our families to the best of our
> abilities.~ Karen
